DataElement.preferredName: Transrectal Ultrasound Biopsy of Prostate Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date of the prostate transrectal ultrasound guided biopsy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Transrectal Ultrasound Biopsy of Prostate Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A procedure that uses sound waves to create a video image of the prostate gland. A small, lubricated probe placed into the rectum releases sound waves, which create echoes as they enter the prostate. Prostate tumors sometimes create echoes that are different from normal prostate tissue. The echoes that bounce back are sent to a computer that translates the pattern of echoes into a picture of the prostate._Removal of tissue from the prostate for microscopic examination._Performed; carried out.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure that uses sound waves to create a video image of the prostate gland. A small, lubricated probe placed into the rectum releases sound waves, which create echoes as they enter the prostate. Prostate tumors sometimes create echoes that are different from normal prostate tissue. The echoes that bounce back are sent to a computer that translates the pattern of echoes into a picture of the prostate.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that uses sound waves to create a video image of the pelvic organs and tissues. A small, lubricated probe placed into the rectum releases sound waves, which create echoes as they enter a pelvic organ. The echoes that bounce back are sent to a computer that translates the pattern of echoes into a picture of the specific organ under examination.  This procedure is most often used to evaluate the prostate gland.

Property.preferredDefinition: Removal of tissue from the prostate for microscopic examination.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: Removal of tissue from the prostate for microscopic examination.
Executed and carried through to completion.
